body:
Hello @jschendel! Thanks for updating the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/conftest.py`](https://github.com/jschendel/pandas/blob/2d240f2584086189c0ad9e5297cdd74ce5efe0e4/pandas/conftest.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/arrays/interval.py`](https://github.com/jschendel/pandas/blob/2d240f2584086189c0ad9e5297cdd74ce5efe0e4/pandas/core/arrays/interval.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/interval.py`](https://github.com/jschendel/pandas/blob/2d240f2584086189c0ad9e5297cdd74ce5efe0e4/pandas/core/indexes/interval.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/arrays/interval/test_interval_ops.py`](https://github.com/jschendel/pandas/blob/2d240f2584086189c0ad9e5297cdd74ce5efe0e4/pandas/tests/arrays/interval/test_interval_ops.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/scalar/interval/test_interval_ops.py`](https://github.com/jschendel/pandas/blob/2d240f2584086189c0ad9e5297cdd74ce5efe0e4/pandas/tests/scalar/interval/test_interval_ops.py) !

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22939?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [5ce06b5...a765e93](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22939?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Created a common mixin class for the tests:
- Put the mixin class in `tests/arrays/interval/interval_ops.py`
  - Not sure that this is the best location; any better alternatives?
  - Kind of gross import in the `indexes` tests: `from ...arrays.interval.interval_ops`
- Created `test_interval_ops.py` files in both the `indexes` and `arrays` subfolders that use the mixin.
lgtm. if you have any other comments @jorisvandenbossche or @TomAugspurger otherwise merge away.

ping @jorisvandenbossche @TomAugspurger : I'm planning to merge this within the next couple days so I can have a method to test out in the interval accessor PR.  Just wanted to give both of you a quick heads up in case either of you wanted to review prior to this getting merged.  The interval accessor PR has some merge conflicts that need to be resolved, so no immediate rush, but I'm planning to address the conflicts soon.
thanks @jschendel pls follow up as needed.
